description: "Try ReScript via CLI"

---

# Try via CLI

You can compile a file directly via `bsc MyFile.re` (or `bsc MyFile.ml`):

<CodeTab labels={["Reason (Old Syntax)", "ML (Older Syntax)"]}>

```re
// MyFile.re
let rec fib = n => {
  switch (n) {
  | 0 | 1 => n
  | n => fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2)
  }
};
Js.log(fib(0));
```
```ml
// MyFile.ml
let rec fib n =
  match n with
  | 0 | 1 -> n
  | n -> (fib (n - 1)) + (fib (n - 2))
let _ = Js.log (fib 0)
```

</CodeTab>

```sh
‚ùØ bsc MyFile.re
// Generated by BUCKLESCRIPT, PLEASE EDIT WITH CARE
'use strict';
function fib(n) {
  if (n === 0 || n === 1) {
    return 1;
  } else {
    return fib(n - 1 | 0) + fib(n - 2 | 0) | 0;
  }
}
console.log(fib(0));
exports.fib = fib;
/*  Not a pure module */
```

You can also get the inferred signature directly via `bsc -i MyFile.re`

<CodeTab labels={["Reason (Old Syntax)", "ML (Older Syntax)"]}>

```rei
let fib: int => int;
```
```mli
val fib: int => int
```

</CodeTab>
